name: Pimp C
description:
'''Chad Lamont Butler''' (December 29, 1973 â€“ December 4, 2007), better known by his stage name '''Pimp C''', was an American rapper and record producer. He was best known for his work with [[Bun B]] as one half of the [[hip-hop]] duo [[UGK|Underground Kingz (UGK)]].

Signing with [[Jive Records]] in 1992, UGK released their major-label debut studio album ''[[Too Hard to Swallow]]'' to critical acclaim. Their subsequent albums, ''[[Super Tight]]'' (1994) and ''[[Ridin' Dirty]]'' (1996), both entered the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. The group received national attention after appearing on [[Jay-Z]]'s 2000 single "[[Big Pimpin']]", which peaked at number 18 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]].

The group went on hiatus for the first half of the 2000s after Pimp C was sentenced to eight years in prison for a probation violation. During this time both members pursued solo careers, with Pimp C releasing his solo debut, ''[[Sweet James Jones Stories|The Sweet James Jones Stories]]'', in 2005, composed of material recorded prior to his sentencing. After being released from prison in December 2005, he released his second solo album, ''[[Pimpalation]]'', in 2006. UGK released their [[Underground Kingz|eponymous fifth studio album]] (2007); it spawned the single "[[International Players Anthem (I Choose You)]]" (featuring [[OutKast]]), which peaked at number 70 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100.

Pimp C was found dead in his hotel room on December 4, 2007, with a coroner's report attributing his death to complications from his heavy consumption of [[lean (drug)|lean]] and pre-existing [[sleep apnea]].
